cpi.title: Consumer Price Index (CPI);
cpi.summary: CPI measures the average change over time in the prices of a 'basket' of goods and services purchased by households.
cpi.detail: When CPI rises, the purchasing power of money falls — the same amount buys fewer goods in the future. Over time, inflation erodes nominal returns, which is why viewing ‘real’ returns (after inflation) is meaningful.
cpi.note: Note: CPI differs from HICP (Harmonised Index), which is widely used in the EU by the ECB/Eurostat.
